Reviews.Title: “Home Suite Home”
Reviews.Author: Bluefoot
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent five-day stay at the Homewood Suites in Indianapolis in mid-March. The hotel is quiet, nicely run and in every way worked for us on an extended visit. The rooms were very comfortable, large and, well, suite-like. The free breakfast each morning was terrific. They even have free dinners four nights a week, which weas very good the evening we took advantage of it. With a large business clientele bas the services were what they needed to be, a comfortable and proferssional business center, unedning flow of coffee, etc. The site is a little remote from downtown in this very large-in-area city but that actually worked well for us -- plus it is close to the shopping ares of the northern quadrant and the arts facilities of adjacent Carmel. We liked this place a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susie W
Reviews.Content: As I was relocating from Chicago to Indianapolis for work, I stayed at this property. It is absolutely amazing. It is quiet but centrally located. The facilities are more like apartments than a true "hotel" environment. Perks include dinner M-Th and breakfast every morning. Very friendly an addommoding staff. Laundry. Gym facilities. They only have an outdoor pool, so not a place for swimmers in the winter. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. You cannot go wrong staying here. Well done, Homewood Suites @ The Crossing.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: vengajen
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for one night, and we loved it! The suites are like small apartments and are very well laid out. I imagine that it would be a great extended stay hotel as the units have small efficiency kitchens. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, perfect for weekend or longer”
Reviews.Author: plainfieldmom
Reviews.Content: Checkin was a breeze. Staff very polite and friendly. Nice to have breakfast included. Morning staff worked constantly, as hotel seemed to have several groups staying. Dinner offerings during the week seem like a nice bonus. Room clean and comfortable. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Book it!”
Reviews.Author: xuan02
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a spacious suite with two beds. The fireplace was awesome. We didn't use the kitchen, but it was really well-equipped. The suite was very clean. The hot breakfast was delicious and plentiful. This property offers a free evening dinner, too. They served ravioli, scrumptious bread sticks and a crisp salad the one evening we were there. What a great deal!The property is quiet and feels secluded. Just a really nice stay. I wish we would have stayed longer, but we were just passing through.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ALP1991
Reviews.Content: This is a hidden gem. A few blocks away from the main area of "The Crossing" but well worth the effort. The hotel is clean, quiet and has very large rooms. I was expecting breakfast to be included, but to my surprise, dinner was included also. OK, only one entree choice, but it was fine with me, plus there was a salad bar, bread, steamed veggies and cookies. All you can eat. Nice. Plus, the staff was super nice. I would definitely return again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: William H
Reviews.Content: Just finished a Sun. - Thurs. 5 week stay at this Homewood Suites for classes I was attending in Indy. Can't say enough GOOD things about the amenities and the staff at this hotel. The suites are large and quiet, the manager's reception saves $$ by not having to buy breakfast and also dinner on the nights it is offered, and the facilities have a study with computers available and a small, but well equipped exercise room. The suite I was in (kept the same one for each week) was large with flat screen tv's in the living and bedroom. Frig, dishwaher and stovetop in the kitchenette and large bathroom. Staff really was the icing on the cake - great people, and very accomodating. Would recommend to anyone planning a stay in Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this hotel as high school 50th reunion headquarters!”
Reviews.Author: gold3493
Reviews.Content: We had blocked some rooms and used 11 suites for 2 nights for our 50th high school reunion. They put all of us together in same general vicinity, gave a list of who was in which room, allowed us to visit in the breakfast area late in the evenings. Great service, great breakfast, very enjoyable stay. Even though I live 15 m. away, I stayed with friends here to be part of the fun.

Reviews.Title: “I can't say enough great things about this place...”
Reviews.Author: Annie M
Reviews.Content: I am a semi-frequent traveler (staying in hotels 1-4 times a month) and a Hilton HHonors Diamond member. I recently discovered this hotel because I was looking for a place convenient to I-465/I-69 North. I now stay here any chance I can book a room while in Indianapolis. They don’t have an indoor pool, but if I can book a fireplace room, that makes up for it with my children in the winter months. This place serves a very nice breakfast in the morning and it seems they always have warm coffee available for guests. It’s the most convenient Hilton brand hotel to Keystone at the Crossing mall (great shopping). The rooms are spacious and CLEAN. I was impressed. The only issue I've experienced was this past weekend when the person staying in the room above me was very noisy around 3 a.m. (both nights) and woke us all up both times. The staff is very friendly. Thanks to Cathy for working with me last minute a few days ago. I really appreciated her help and she was very kind and super helpful. My children like staying here because they say it’s like a home away from home. I have to agree with them. We’ll be returning as often as we can when traveling in the area and look forward to trying the outdoor pool and Jacuzzi in the warmer months!

Reviews.Title: “A Complete Review from a Business Travelor Staying For Awhile”
Reviews.Author: Gary0001
Reviews.Content: I like staying here for a number of reasons. Indy has bad areas, please be aware. This area called The Crossings is a good area and the hotel is located in a pleasant and quiet space, surrounded by trees... very homey and park-like - different from the 'off the freeway-ers'... yet it is 30 seconds from Keystone Blvd and 2 minutes from the freeways. It is about 8 miles or so from downtown, it takes 20-30 minutes to get there.... (Keystone south to River Parkway, turn right to Meridian then left). This is an affluent area, close to Carmel, and 2 shopping malls, drug stores, Target, groceries, a hundred restaurants of all types, Fresh Market, Bonefish Grill, et al. Now, for the hotel. It is an outside access hotel, it's a Homewood Suites not a Hilton. 2 floors, no elevators... stairs. I stay on the first floor, I hear the second floor shoes at times, but nothing from the side rooms. My room is like a 1 bedroom apartment, w/a king bed and a pull out sofa which I haven't used. The bath area is nice. There is a stove, dishwasher, refrig, sink, microwave, 2 flat screen TVs. There is wireless internet and a lot of drawers. My room has been clean and I am picky... not brand new untouched but nice and clean. I stay here versus downtown because I like the staff. They will do whatever it takes to please normal folks... (cranky types seem to be 'cranky' no matter what.. I guess. What is SPECIAL about this Homewood Suites is that their food is demonstrably better.. and it comes with the room. Usually I don't each the 'breakfast' at the free food hotels... I just don't like the quality, but I like the food here. There is a nice breakfast of eggs, meat, potato, cereals, bagels and bread, juices, waffles, yoghurt. There is always fresh fruit, generally 2/3 types and an onsite pay-pantry. Monday thu Thursday they have a nice dinner which is filling and creative. Ex: this week: Potato crusted cod, Rotisserie chicken, Beef Lasagna, Teriaki glazed Asian chicken... all with vegetables, a starch and always a soup and a very nice spinach/lettuce salad with trimmings.There is a comfortable dining and sitting area, a nice laundry and workout roon, a meeting room and a business room, too. There is an outside pool and jacuzzu which I haven't used (closed for winter). I have always been able to get a (free) parking space close to my room. Staying downtown means another $25/day for parking. As someone who stays on an extended basis I am here for a while and can notice things you may not notice staying one/two days.... but I find the stay very pleasant and comfortable and equitable. That's why I give it a well-rounded 5...as I am satisified... and it I wasn't I would go elsewhere.. and I personally like the staff, they are very nice and attentive to making me feel welcome. Just ask them to help you and they will. Oh.. there is a shuttle van to take you anywhere within the area (not the airport)... good when my wife visited and I took the car to work.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hilton Property”
Reviews.Author: cbce1pjb
Reviews.Content: I will combine my review of the Hotel and Lucas Oil Stadium. The Hotel was excellent. absolutely nothing negative to say. Breakfast,staff,room,internet.parking,everything outstanding. This hotel is close to Keystone Crossing shopping Center,and on Saturday night you had to hunt for a parking spot. We tried to eat at The Cheesecake Factory,A minimum one hour wait. Forget it. We attended a Indy Colts game on Sunday afternoon against the Falcons.Paid 16$ for tickets in section 626 Row 20. This is an excellent facility.Even in the Upper deck you could see the field great.This is a state of the art football stadium. I would certainly return to both the hotel and Lucas Oil Field. Parked at 327N Illinois street about a 15 min walk,advance pay only for 5$. Anthing around Lucas Oil Field was 20-30$.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tennessean865
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a very nice section of Indianapolis. We called ahead and requested 2 cribs which were set up and waiting for us when we arrived at the room (something we don't take for granted anymore given past experience). We had a 1 bedroom suite and it was plenty of room for the 4 of us. The bathroom was huge, the bed was comfortable, and the rooms have very nice TVs (it looked like a 32" LCD on the wall in the bedroom). Every imaginable higher end restaurant and department store is within 1 mile of this hotel. Restaurants like Flemings, Ruth's Chris, PF Chang's, Sullivan's, etc all within a 3-5 minute car ride. We didn't go to the Fashion Mall but it looked very nice and was close by as well. The only negative thing that I would give this hotel was the breakfast. I know many reviewers have rated this highly so maybe sampling it on a weekend we hit it at a bad time. Yes, it is certainly a step up from the cereal, bagel, toast options of many 3* and 4* hotels, but that was about it. The hot breakfast was just standard issue cafeteria eggs, bacon, and a waffle maker with patrons lined up 5 deep. The Homewood Suites competes directly with Embassy Suites in the same business niche. I have stayed at both chains several times and this is one area where Embassy is still light years ahead of Homewood. Overall a great hotel and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “family friendly room - loved it”
Reviews.Author: AJDiamond
Reviews.Content: We had a competition down in Indy this past summer and stayed at this hotel. Greta breakfast for the family included in the price. Close to a grocery store and the room has good sized kithchen/fridge. Close to mall and lots of restaurants as well. Plenty of parking and the rooms are spacious and you can spread out. Great experience. If you have 2-3 children or more this hotel is big enough. We had two double beds in room and pull out in the family room.

Reviews.Title: “nice quiet place with all the amenities”
Reviews.Author: dave c
Reviews.Content: my family and i loved the property as well as the very helpful staff. The welcome home dinner and fresh start complimentary meals were the frosting on the cake. The entire staff were friendly, courteous, and helpful. W e will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Pennyth
Reviews.Content: this was the best place to stay. The whole staff was so Nice and always willing to go out of their way to make my stay more comfortable. I will never stay anywhere else but the homewood suite

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Bdubb81
Reviews.Content: Everyone at this hotel is kind and generous. They made the stay perfect. It is in the middle of lots of things to do. Would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Indianapolis and staying the night.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and very welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: kitzg
Reviews.Content: We will use this hotel again! We stayed there as the closest hotel to my sister's wedding, and for the bit of luxury of a Homewood Suites. When our dog needed to accompany us we were thrilled he could stay, too. The room and bed were very comfortable. The breakfast was far above the average hotel free breakfast. The staff treated us like honored guests. While this is not in the heart of tourist areas it is nestled in a neighborhood but near good restaurants. And just minutes off of the highway surrounding Indianapolis

Reviews.Title: “Nicely decorated and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Luciadunn
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at how nice this hotel was since we had been to other suite hotel that were not as nice as this one. The decor was tasteful and the refrigerator was 3/4 the size of a regular one and as clean as could be. Glasses, silverware and dishes were very nice looking and the room was cosy and comfortable. The thermostat was excellent and immediately responded to any changes.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Family Escape”
Reviews.Author: tracimed
Reviews.Content: Free hot breakfast and a free hot dinner everyday...what could be better? Well, the pool was excellent as well. My children had a great time and I could relax because the pool was clean. The suite was very nice for 2 kids and a husband. The beds were comfortable. The kitchen was great - the fridge really came in handy. The staff were very nice and helpful. We are going to stay here again next time we are in Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Like a resort”
Reviews.Author: CoupleFl
Reviews.Content: This was the most unique Homewood Suite we have seen. Instead of 1 large multistory building there were several smaller buildings with 20 or so units in each building. You must walk outside to get from your room to the lobby and dining area but it created a resort style atmosphere. It was very pleasant. Complimentary breakfast and managers reception was good. The dining room service was outstanding especially compared to all the other homewood suites we have seen. They could not do enough for us. Normally at these complimentay functions you get your own food and clean your place. Although we did get our own food they were there if we wanted more to drink and carry our dishes away. We had a small problem there but but it was taken care of promptly by the manager, Kathy. She made sure we were completely satified before we left. I only mention this because Kathy was so gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and value!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cropguy
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel for lodging for our company Christmas party. We have used this hotel before with good satisfaction and this time was no exception. The rooms are recently remodeled and updated. This hotel is a great value! The suites include a seperate bedroom and bath room, living room, and kitchenette. Flat screen HD tvs in the living room and bedroom. It is very quiet and secluded, but really close to high end shopping and dining. It is easy to get to off the interstate. The breakfast is excellent with hot waffles, bacon, eggs, oatmeal, french toast as well as great coffee and juices. The staff was always helpful and attentive. We will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “One excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Taffeta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Homewood Suites at the Crossing on Aug. 20 & 21 as part of a group attending a wedding. My mother and I roomed together. We both loved the room, with its two flat-screen TVs, fireplace, comfortable furniture, well-stocked kitchen, and nice decor. The bathroom was one of the type where the tub, shower, and toilet are in their own separate room with a door that can be closed between that area and the place where the sink and vanity are. This is always appreciated in a room where two people are staying and both need to get ready for an event. I stay at hotels for work about 3-4 times per year, and have to say that the free breakfast was superlative -- quality and amount of food available were both excellent. We didn't even need to use the kitchen in our suite, except the coffee maker. We did have one little problem, as there was a slight but noticeable smell in our room (only noticed it when first walking in, for about 5 minutes). It didn't seem quite right, so I reported it at the front desk the morning we were leaving. There happened to be a maintenance man also standing there, and I was very impressed that he took out a notebook and started writing in it about the smell just as I was explaining it to the desk clerk. Overall, this was an excellent hotel, not far from a ton of shopping and lots of restaurants. It was a great place to stay during the wedding weekend. I only have one photo of the inside of the living room in our suite. I'll upload it here.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, lots of space”
Reviews.Author: kiwifuz
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through an event we were attending at the State Fair Grounds. This hotel was listed as the official hotel with a shuttle to & from the event. My husband & I shared the room with my sister and her husband. The set-up of the room was great. You entered into a living room/kitchen area. There is a small table with two chairs for eating. A fridge, sink, dishwasher, stove top, & microwave, line the wall opposite the door. Our room had a couch & a chair in the living room space to the right and a tv in front of the couch. To the right, beyond the couch, was a doorway into one of the bedrooms. This room just had a (double) bed with a nightstand and a flat screen tv attached to the wall. The other bedroom was more to the left of the living area. It had a king bed, nightstand, desk w/ chair, dresser, & another flat screen tv. The bathroom was through the bedroom with the king size bed. The set-up was fine since we were all family members sharing the room. I wasn't super fond of the sink area being open to the main bedroom; it can just be annoying if someone is in the bathroom when you're trying to sleep. Since we stayed on a Saturday night there was no evening snack reception but there was coffee when we got back on Saturday night and breakfast the next morning. Breakfast was pretty basic. Scrambled eggs, sausage, oatmeal, toast, cereal, yogurt, etc. For the $110 that we paid for the room it was a great deal. The outside entrances and hauling luggage up the stairs probably isn’t great for everyone. Parking seemed reasonably plentiful close to our room. When we arrived at the hotel, the event we were headed to started in about two and a half hours. Lucky we asked the front desk about the shuttle because they were already full?! But before I could get really angry the manager stepped in and said that he’d run an early shuttle for us if we wanted and he’d set up cabs to make sure everyone got to the event & back. He gave us his card and the name of the cab company he uses and said to just let them know to call him about the fare. Excellent! I’d totally stay at this hotel again, especially for more than two people. I don’t know that the two bedroom, two bath rooms are all that affordable though, I’d stick with the two bedroom option with one bath still. Location wise this hotel is right off of 465 and near shopping & restaurants. (Please excuse the less than stellar cell phone photos. They are of the remodeled rooms unlike the older photos on this site.)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Super for family.”
Reviews.Author: formosan
Reviews.Content: We love to drive around the country and have always stayed at Hilton or Marriott chains. This homewood is located only 1-2 minutes from the ramp, in a quiet residential neighborhood, away from the Mall traffic and highway noise, and yet has all the convenience that any traveler needs (food, shopping etc.). The lodges look more like a gated condo than hotels. That's the beauty of it. We stayed at King suite. Rooms are new and clean. With 2 young kids (3 & 7), it is big enough. The breakfast was SUPER! No paper plates or plastic forks! My husband never likes hot oatmeal but he couldn't stop getting more after 1 bowl.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, super clean, pool, jacuzzt, and great buisness room with internet”
Reviews.Author: indianapolisfolks
Reviews.Content: My family and I are living here for a month ubtil our real home is ready. It is great. The following is included. Breakfast, dinner, fitness room, internet, faxing, and more. It is all of great quality. Staff is very polite and always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “what a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Box2105
Reviews.Content: This hotel has just undergone remodeling. At first I was set back by the detached buildings but by the second night they grew on me and I enjoyed my stroll down the sidewalks to my room. Its like staying at a resort. They had a complimentary "managers reception" that included beer & wine and a buffet of real food. Rooms are like small apartments and they have flat screen TVs in the bed rooms. Breakfast was included in the room price and it really hit the spot with real food again, not just cereal, bagels, and waffles; but oatmeal, eggs, sausage, and potatoes. Also, people who stay there seem more social that most places I go. They seemed to stay long in the lobby area with their laptops to do casual work or just be there to watch the community TVs.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice, with quirks”
Reviews.Author: syzygymfl
Reviews.Content: My first stay at a Homewood Suites. The food from 5-7pm was unexceptional but there was plenty of it, and you could easily make a free dinner out of it. The people bringing around the fruit were very pleasant. The pool doesn't open until 9 AM which is unfortunate if you want to use the jacuzzi to get the kinks out in the morning. The rooms are big and spaceous, and the internet access was fast enough and free. It is on the wrong side of the highway from most of the local restaurants and shopping- yuou wouldn;t walk from this hotel to anywhere. If you go, know it's on the south side of 86th street, because the signs are understated and you might miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Homewood standards”
Reviews.Author: midwtrav
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites are usually a great property - nicely appointed rooms, lots of space, etc. This Homewood is in a good location -- near the Fashion Mall and far enough off the street to be quiet. It seems like an old apartment complex that was converted into the hotel. The floor plan of the room is similar to other Homewoods. We stayed in a 1-br king suite and there was a spacious living room separated by a door from a bedroom with a king bed and bathroom. The room is nicely furnished with a couch, easy chairs, full kitchen, TV, and small dining table in the living area, and desk, dresser, bed, and TV in the bedroom. Unfortunately, the hotel was otherwise run-down. The exterior of the building with our room was in bad need of attention, with peeling paint on the doors. The room itself, despite the nice furnishings had a terribly moldy smell. The fitness center was poorly set up - two treadmills and an elliptical. bench, but no weights. All of the equipment facing away from the TV. Overall, not a terrible hotel, but not nearly up to the standards of other Homewoods where I have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Block Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: soontobebride321
Reviews.Content: My wedding venue for my march wedding is very close to the Homewood Suites. I had called them last year asking to block rooms and received horrible service. A few months later I received an e-mail from another person apologizing for the service and asking for my business. The person I had worked with before had left the company and they went through old e-mails to find clients that he might have lost. They even gave me a comped room to make up for my troubles! I was so excited! I sent out my save the dates with hotel information and everything was going great until I found out that my wedding venue was closing a month before my wedding. I quickly found a new venue and called Homewood to cancel my block of rooms. The lady said very rude and sarcastically (and I quote) "Well that sucks because we've turned down a lot of business to get rooms for your wedding" and my response was "I'm sorry. I'm two months from my wedding and my wedding venue just told me they are closing!" The lady continued to argue with me that I shouldn't go to downtown Indy that I should find a location closer to their hotel. She wasn't understanding, she had NO compassion and quite frankly she was a B****. The hotel is convenient and they are doing renovations, but all of the guests who had booked a room with them had a horrible experience as well.

Reviews.Title: “Well Done”
Reviews.Author: Farmerville
Reviews.Content: Sometimes it seems our group has stayed at every hotel in Indianapolis for race weekends. This hotel worked out extremely well. The suite allowed for adults and teenagers to have separate space. The kitchen was perfect for storing our race day lunch things that needed refrigeration. The breakfast was varied and appealed to everyone in our group. The pink wallpaper in the hallways and the old-style TV sets are due for replacement and upgrading but otherwise the rooms were well maintained, the linens were of high quality and everything was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Homewood”
Reviews.Author: AprilHoneymoon2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood suites for the Indy 500. We enjoyed the large room and kitchen. The hotel was in reasonable distance to the track, dining and other points of interest. The breakfast each day was delicious. Apparently in the evenings (non weekends) they do a complimentary food and beverages. The pool was always stocked with towels and was never too crowded. The fitness center could use a revamp but it worked and it was great to have access to two computers with internet. We didn't bring a pet but we could hear a couple barking through the doors. Overall good stay-it was a nice place to return to at the end of our adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood not Home in Indy”
Reviews.Author: thedoglady
Reviews.Content: We flew in on Christmas day. There are serious health issues in the family with our relatives so we were sent to Homewood Suites. We returned 6pm on the 26th and our room wasn't cleaned. My husband took wet towels to the desk and was given a few new towels but no apology for not cleaning our room. That evening I wrote to Hilton and received a reply that they were looking into it and I have a case number. They cleaned the room the next day. Today we left at 10 am and returned at three, and no-one had cleaned. My husband called and we left for two hours and it was done. I've been to hotels for many years and never returned to an unmade room or had to remind staff to clean. When one is dealing with family matters, a hotel should be the least of problems. This is not the case here. Also they spray this sickly awful stuff to make the place smell as if it was cleaned. I should have known, as there was a note a couple of doors down saying "PLEASE NO SPRAY!"

Reviews.Title: “So so Homewood”
Reviews.Author: carztraveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times over the last couple of years as an alternative to downtown Indianapolis hotels. This is the standard Homewood Suites with refrigerator, cooktop, living room, bedroom and bath. It has always been a pleasant stay. This time however, I have noticed a steep decline in the place. Pros: Beds are standard Homewood beds: excellent and clean with comfortable pillows. Baths have been updated with arced shower rod and new shower enclosure. Lots of room, good layout. Good free breakfast. Cons: This place needs a remodel. Most Homewoods seem to have some kind of ongoing renovations going on to keep the furniture, carpet and fittings new. The micro and stovetop were really old. The furniture was clean. Decor seemed somewhat dated. The vanity area was basic and older. Front desk did not seem terribly professional. Although it was a night with very low occupancy, they had not glanced at room preferences. There are rooms with exterior corridors and interior corridors. If safety is an issue, I would choose the interior corridor buildiings. This is however, one of the few Indy area (decent) hotels that accepts pets, so I may stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelIllinois
Reviews.Content: The room was big with a living room with fire place, full size kitchen, nice size bedroom with 2 beds and a TV, bathroom. Hot breakfast each morning was nice. I used the sauna and jacuzzi. They also had a half court basketball area. I was impressed. The only drawback was the staff. Front desk staff could not figure out how to charge two nights stay with 2 different credit cards. I wanted to pay for one night and my friend wanted to pay for the other night but staff couldn't figure out how to do this.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: oneyouth
Reviews.Content: We took a large group (70) to this hotel as we were in Indy for a convention. We were there for a week. We thought we were going to get an incredible hotel but turned out to be more problems than we thought. The first day was filled with room confusion. Not to mention they gave us a few smoking rooms that they said were "cleaned" with a deodorizer. They still smelled horrible. The housekeeping was horrible! we never had our rooms cleaned, maybe the bed made, but that was it. They reused our towels and folded them and did not get us new ones. The staff made promises they couldn't keep and over charged us on some rooms. many of the staff we dealt with were not professional with us. The internet worked sporadically as did the television. The only good thing was the food. they did that well out of everything. I have to say, this was not a pleasing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: taeshatama
Reviews.Content: My spouse and 2 children stayed here after a 13 hour day in the car. What a nice place! The staff was very friendly, the room was clean and comfortable, and the breakfast was great. The room was a small suite, but had a full fridge, cooktop, microwave and small sink. When traveling with kids, it's great to have a seperate room and TV (with DVD player) for kids and adults alike to relax, as well as a small kitchen area. The bed was really comfortable. The climate was controlled by thermostat (i.e. no noisy window unit), and it was very quiet. There was an outdoor pool and basketball court (I don't think it was lighted, so don't worry about a 3am game...) and the grounds were spotless and well-groomed. It's true that there is no central elevator, but you can park really close to the elevator for each seperate building. The breakfast was really good: scrambled eggs, sausage, freshly-cooked waffles, fresh fruit and all the usual continental fare. Apparently, during the week, they have a free, light dinner including wine and beer (we were there on the weekend, though). For the price, it is a deal; we've paid more for a standard room at a Hampton or comparable hotel and received much, much less in return. The location is close to shopping and just about any restaurant you might want. We liked this place a lot, and will return anytime we need to stay in Indy, and will search for other Homewood locations when on the road.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: SavvyTravellerPA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites during a recent junior tennis touranment. The room was clean, everything functioned, and the hotel honored our request for a quiet room on the top floor. The only thing that lacked a bit was the breakfast, as no fresh fruit was available and the bagels were a bit stale (at 8am). Otherwise, we would again choose this hotel when visiting Indianapolis

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay on the North side”
Reviews.Author: arelcee
Reviews.Content: Spotless rooms. Excellent amenities. Plenty of room and excellent conditions. Great privacy. Plenty of parking. Polite and hardworking staff.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Keystone_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Upon the recommendation of a client two years ago, I stayed at the Homewood Suites. Four business trips later, I continue to stay here whenever I travel to Indianapolis. Obviously the location is convenient if you have business on the north or northeast side of Indianapolis. The staff have always been friendly and polite. The rooms are spacious and clean; the breakfast is delicious; and things such as water pressure, temperature, and climate control have not been a problem. The location is convenient to the restaurants and bars of the Broad Ripple area. For joggers, the Monon Trail is a short drive away. Malls and stores abound. The only inconvenience is trying to make a left turn out of the hotel's parking lot onto 86th Street during the morning rush hour. Have patience. Overall, this hotel offers all types of travelers a pleasant stay on the northside of Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mike3412
Reviews.Content: This is our first stay in a Homewood Suites so we don't have any other Homewood Suites to compare it to like the previous reviewer did. We thought that compared to other moderate hotel chains we often stay in that this was quite nice. It's nice to have the fridge and microwave, and the suite is bigger than just a hotel room would be. The free breakfast and light dinner were very good. The staff are amoung the friendliest I have ever dealt with and the room and grounds were spotless. We usually stay at the Sheraton in Indianapolis and we find it's nice to be able to park close to your room and not have to be constantly taking evevators like we have to do at the Sheraton (we travel with our dog and he has to go outside every few hours). We come to Indianapolis every couple of weeks and will be staying here from now on.

HotelInfo.Name: Homewood Suites by Hilton Indianapolis At The Crossing
HotelInfo.Address: 2501 East 86th Street, Indianapolis, IN 46240
